publication.abstract: Â© 2014 The Author.SensA is a web-based application for sensitivity analysis of mathematical models. The sensitivity analysis is based on metabolic control analysis, computing the local, global and time-dependent properties of model components. Interactive visualization facilitates interpretation of usually complex results. SensA can contribute to the analysis, adjustment and understanding of mathematical models for dynamic systems.
publication.title: SensA: Web-based sensitivity analysis of SBML models

summary.description: A web-based application for sensitivity analysis of mathematical models. The sensitivity analysis is based on metabolic control analysis, computing the local, global and time-dependent properties of model components. Interactive visualisation facilitates interpretation of usually complex results.
summary.name: SensA
